entries.meaning: (linguistics) A sound change converting a consonant into /z/, the voiced alveolar sibilant.
examples: In the Lettish language, which partakes altogether of a more modern character, the zetacism seizes the dentals, gutterals [sic], sibilants and liquids  [â€¦]

entries.meaning: (linguistics) The lack of a sound change in a language when languages in the same family undergo rhotacism.
